title: dev-build command : get the spack-xxx directories created out of source
body:
Currently, when doing  :
``` 
cd some_place
spack dev-build -d location_of_source --drop-in zsh some_package  
```
spack creates a few `spack-xxx` files and a directory (`spack-build-yyy`) that are located under `location_of_source`, i.e. "in source". 

```
$ cd some_package && ls -1dF spack-*
spack-build-env.txt
spack-build-out.txt
spack-build-zp32c65/
spack-configure-args.txt
```

Note that in my use case `some_package` is a CMakePackage, hence capable of out-of-source builds (from the `spack-build-zp32c65/` in this example). So technically speaking the build is out-of-source, but the directory is in-source (hope my description makes sense).

### Rationale

Keep the source directory clean.

### Description

I would like to have the option to get those files/directories created in `some_place` (i.e. the directory from where the spack dev-build command was launched) instead of "polluting" the source directory. And/or have an option in the `dev-build` command to choose the destination directory.

### General information

* **Spack:** 0.16.0-951-3893ce8f71
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** darwin-bigsur-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
